content.title: Secondary Lymphedema Causes

definition.primary: Lymphedema resulting from damage to or obstruction of a previously normal lymphatic system, most commonly due to cancer treatment (surgery, radiation), infection, trauma, or chronic venous disease in developed countries.
key_concepts: Far more common than primary lymphedema (90% of cases globally)
Cancer treatment is leading cause in developed nations
Filariasis is leading cause worldwide (especially tropics)
May develop immediately or years after inciting event

incidence_by_cancer_type.incidence: 20-40% with full axillary dissection, 5-10% with sentinel node biopsy

surgery.mechanism: Removal of lymph nodes disrupts drainage pathways
surgery.examples: Axillary dissection, inguinal lymphadenectomy, radical hysterectomy

radiation.mechanism: Fibrosis of lymphatics and lymph nodes
radiation.latency: May develop months to years after treatment
radiation.synergy: Risk dramatically increased when combined with surgery

tumor_obstruction.mechanism: Direct tumor compression or infiltration of lymphatics

filariasis.mechanism: Wuchereria bancrofti, Brugia malayi parasites lodge in lymphatics causing inflammation and fibrosis
filariasis.distribution: Endemic in tropical Africa, Asia, Pacific Islands
filariasis.progression: Repeated infections lead to progressive lymphedema (elephantiasis)

recurrent_cellulitis.cycle: Lymphedema predisposes to cellulitis, cellulitis worsens lymphedema

trauma.accidental: Severe crush injury, burns affecting lymphatics

chronic_venous_disease.mechanism: Persistent venous hypertension overloads lymphatic system
chronic_venous_disease.progression: Phlebolymphedema - combined venous and lymphatic insufficiency

inflammatory.rheumatologic: Rheumatoid arthritis, psoriatic arthritis can damage lymphatics
inflammatory.podoconiosis: Non-filarial endemic elephantiasis from prolonged barefoot exposure to volcanic soil

mechanism.initial_phase: Lymphatic obstruction leads to accumulation of protein-rich interstitial fluid
mechanism.tissue_changes: Adipose deposition, fibrosis, and irreversible tissue changes
mechanism.skin_changes: Thickening, hyperkeratosis, papillomatosis in advanced disease

pathophysiology.progression: Without treatment, advances through reversible edema to irreversible fibrotic changes

isl_staging.stage_0: Subclinical - lymphatic damage present but no visible swelling
isl_staging.stage_1: Soft pitting edema, reversible with elevation
isl_staging.stage_2: Non-pitting edema, fibrotic changes, does not resolve with elevation
isl_staging.stage_3: Lymphostatic elephantiasis - severe volume, skin changes, disability

cancer_treatment.rationale: Minimizes lymph node removal while maintaining staging accuracy
Identifies and preserves arm-draining lymphatics during axillary dissection

cancer_treatment.strategy: Lymphatic-venous anastomosis at time of dissection
cancer_treatment.rationale: Prophylactic LYMPHA procedure reduces lymphedema risk

patient_education: Avoid blood pressure cuffs, IV access, blood draws in at-risk limb

phases: Intensive phase: Daily treatment for weeks to achieve maximum reduction
Maintenance phase: Self-management with compression and exercise

physiologic.principle: Connect lymphatic vessels to venules to restore drainage
Transfer lymph nodes with blood supply to affected area

ablative.principle: Remove adipose tissue that accumulates in chronic lymphedema
Excision of affected tissue with skin grafting

content.statement: Secondary Lymphedema Causes is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Lymphatic that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Secondary Lymphedema Causes helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Secondary Lymphedema Causes include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Secondary Lymphedema Causes.

learning_objectives: Identify the major causes of secondary lymphedema
Understand the pathophysiology of lymphatic obstruction
Apply ISL staging to classify disease severity
Describe prevention strategies in cancer treatment
Select appropriate conservative and surgical management
key_points: Cancer treatment is the leading cause in developed countries
Sentinel node biopsy has dramatically reduced breast cancer-related lymphedema
Complete decongestive therapy is cornerstone of management
Surgical options include physiologic (restore drainage) and ablative (reduce volume) approaches
clinical_pearls: Always ask about prior surgery, radiation, infections in lymphedema evaluation
Bilateral lower extremity lymphedema suggests systemic cause or proximal obstruction
Early intervention prevents progression to irreversible fibrotic stage
Cellulitis in lymphedema requires aggressive treatment and prophylaxis
